Raster¶

geoville_storage_gate.raster.create_by_group(array, profile, ncdf_path, group, start_time, end_time, array_variable='raster')¶

Creates a new netcdf file with a new group in which the array will be saved with the identifier “array_variable”. The numpy array needs to have an axis=0 of the same length than the time range in days (start_time - end_time).

Parameters

  • array – numpy array that contains the new data to write

  • profile – dictionary including all metadata (rasterio’s profile)

  • ncdf_path – path to the netcdf file

  • group – group name of the netcdf dataset where the new array or the update will take place

  • start_time – start date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • end_time – end date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • array_variable – Name of the variable within the netcdf group that represents the raster data in form of an array

geoville_storage_gate.raster.get_dates(ncdf_path, group)¶

Returns a list of dates that represent the temporal dimension of a given group.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to the netcdf file

  • group – group name of the netcdf dataset

Returns

list of date strings

geoville_storage_gate.raster.read_by_bounds(ncdf_path, start_time, end_time, bounds, array_variable='raster')¶

Reads a raster (subset) within the given netcdf file. The bounds and array_variable define the file-intern data structure. The bounds come from a vector dataset.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • bounds – boundary for the subset (shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon)

  • start_time – start date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • end_time – end date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • array_variable – Name of the variable within the netcdf group that represents the raster data in form of an array

Returns

raster subset in form of a numpy array and the respective Affine transformation

geoville_storage_gate.raster.read_by_group(ncdf_path, start_time, end_time, group, array_variable='raster')¶

Reads a raster (subset) within the given netcdf file. The group and array_variable define the file-intern data structure.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • group – netcdf group name

  • start_time – start date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • end_time – end date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • array_variable – Name of the variable within the netcdf group that represents the raster data in form of an array

Returns

raster subset in form of a numpy array and the respective Affine transformation

geoville_storage_gate.raster.update_by_bounds(array, profile, ncdf_path, bounds, start_time, end_time, array_variable='raster')¶

Updates a raster (subset) within the given/new netcdf file. The bounds and array_variable define the file-intern data structure. The bounds come from a vector dataset.

Parameters

  • array – numpy array that contains the new data to write

  • profile – dictionary including all metadata (rasterio’s profile)

  • ncdf_path – path to the netcdf file

  • bounds – boundary (shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon) where the new array or the update will take place

  • start_time – start date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • end_time – end date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • array_variable – Name of the variable within the netcdf group that represents the raster data in form of an array

geoville_storage_gate.raster.upsert_by_group(array, profile, ncdf_path, group, start_time, end_time, array_variable='raster')¶

Adds to or updates an existing group within an existing netCDF file. The array will be saved with the identifier “array_variable”. The numpy array needs to have an axis=0 of the same length than the time range in days (start_time - end_time).

Parameters

  • array – numpy array that contains the new data to write

  • profile – dictionary including all metadata (rasterio’s profile)

  • ncdf_path – path to the netcdf file

  • group – group name of the netcdf dataset where the new array or the update will take place

  • start_time – start date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • end_time – end date (e.g. 2019-12-31)

  • array_variable – Name of the variable within the netcdf group that represents the raster data in form of an array
